intro: Ecbolium mannii, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and unique, fig-like fruits. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its fruit is edible and serves as a food source for various wildlife species. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
